intro: Eremostachys hyoscyamoides, commonly known as the desert hound's tongue, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is characterized by its hairy, fleshy leaves and showy, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its unique morphology allows it to conserve water efficiently in harsh environments. Eremostachys hyoscyamoides is often found in desert scrub and sagebrush habitats.
